verses.verse: A Psalm of David. <S%H1732><s%> Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be the LORD <S%H3068><s%> my strength <S%H6697><s%>which teaches <S%H3925><s%> my hands <S%H3027><s%> to war, <S%H4421><s%> <S%H7128><s%> and my fingers <S%H676><s%> to fight: <S%H4421><s%>

My goodness, <S%H2617><s%> and my fortress; <S%H4686><s%> my high <S%H4869><s%> tower, <S%H4869><s%> and my deliverer; <S%H6403><s%> my shield, <S%H4043><s%> and he in whom I trust; <S%H2620><s%> who subdues <S%H7286><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> me.
LORD, <S%H3068><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> is man, <S%H120><s%> that you take knowledge <S%H3045><s%> of him! or the son <S%H1121><s%> of man, <S%H582><s%> that you make account <S%H2803><s%> of him!
Man <S%H120><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> to vanity: <S%H1892><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> are as a shadow <S%H6738><s%> that passes <S%H5674><s%> away.
Bow <S%H5186><s%> your heavens, <S%H8064><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and come <S%H3381><s%> down: <S%H3381><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and they shall smoke. <S%H6225><s%>
Cast <S%H1299><s%> forth lightning, <S%H1300><s%> and scatter <S%H6327><s%> them: shoot <S%H7971><s%> out your arrows, <S%H2671><s%> and destroy <S%H1949><s%> them.

Send <S%H7971><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> from above; <S%H4791><s%> rid <S%H6475><s%> me, and deliver <S%H5337><s%> me out of great <S%H7227><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of strange <S%H5236><s%> children; <S%H1121><s%>

Whose <S%H834><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> vanity, <S%H7723><s%> and their right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> is a right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> of falsehood. <S%H8267><s%>

I will sing <S%H7891><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> song <S%H7892><s%> to you, O God: <S%H430><s%> on a psaltery <S%H5035><s%> and an instrument of ten <S%H6218><s%> strings will I sing <S%H2167><s%> praises to you.

It is he that gives <S%H5414><s%> salvation <S%H8668><s%> to kings: <S%H4428><s%> who delivers <S%H6475><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> from the hurtful <S%H7451><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>

Rid <S%H6475><s%> me, and deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of strange <S%H5236><s%> children, <S%H1121><s%> whose <S%H834><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> vanity, <S%H7723><s%> and their right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> is a right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> of falsehood: <S%H8267><s%>

That our sons <S%H1121><s%> may be as plants <S%H5195><s%> grown <S%H1431><s%> up in their youth; <S%H5271><s%> that our daughters <S%H1323><s%> may be as corner <S%H2106><s%> stones, <S%H2106><s%> polished <S%H2404><s%> after the similitude <S%H8403><s%> of a palace: <S%H1964><s%>

That our garners <S%H4200><s%> may be full, <S%H4392><s%> affording <S%H6329><s%> all manner <S%H2177><s%> of store: that our sheep <S%H6629><s%> may bring <S%H503><s%> forth thousands <S%H503><s%> and ten <S%H7231><s%> thousands <S%H7233><s%> in our streets: <S%H2351><s%>

That our oxen <S%H441><s%> may be strong to labor; <S%H5445><s%> that there be no <S%H369><s%> breaking <S%H6556><s%> in, nor <S%H369><s%> going <S%H3318><s%> out; that there be no <S%H369><s%> complaining <S%H6682><s%> in our streets. <S%H7339><s%>

Happy <S%H835><s%> is that people, <S%H5971><s%> that is in such <S%H3602><s%> a case: <S%H3602><s%> yes, happy <S%H835><s%> is that people, <S%H5971><s%> whose God <S%H430><s%> is the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
